mainmenu.startingmessage: Game that will stimulate your mind!

instruction.GoBackToMainMenu: Press enter to go back to main menu...
instruction.ChoseSudoku: Rules of which sudoku would you like to see:
instruction.ClassicIntro: A standard Sudoku puzzle consists of a grid of 9 blocks. Each block contains 9 boxes arranged in 3 rows and 3 columns.
instruction.ClassicDetails1: Some blocks will be pre-filled for you and they cannot be changed.
instruction.ClassicDetails2: In order to solve the puzzle all 81 boxes must contain numbers and the Sudoku rules must be followed:
instruction.ClassicRule1: 1. Each column must contain all digits from 1 to 9, with no repetitions.
instruction.ClassicRule2: 2. Each row must contain all digits from 1 to 9, with no repetitions.
instruction.ClassicRule3: 3. Each block must contain all digits from 1 to 9, with no repetitions.
instruction.DiagonalIntro: A Diagonal Sudoku puzzle follows the standard rules of Sudoku with one change.
instruction.DiagonalExtra: Additionally both main diagonals must also contain all digits from 1 to 9, with no repetitions.
instruction.JigsawIntro: A Jigsaw Sudoku puzzle is a variant of standard Sudoku where the 9 standard 3x3 boxes are replaced by 9 irregularly shaped regions.
instruction.JigsawChange: The puzzle follows the standard rules of Sudoku with one change:
instruction.JigsawRule3: 3. Each irregular region must contain all digits from 1 to 9, with no repetitions.
instruction.KillerIntro: A Killer Sudoku puzzle follows the standard rules of Sudoku with additional rules:
instruction.KillerCage1: Additionally the grid is divided into cages, outlined with dotted or bold lines.
instruction.KillerCage2: The number shown in the upper corner of the cage is the target sum that the digits within that cage must add up to.
instruction.KillerCage3: In each cage digits cannot be repeated.
